data.title: Modificated some Timer methods, implemented modifications in TimerTest
data.body:
*[gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/utils/Timer.java] Changed types of "postTask", "scheduleTask" and also static "post", "schedule" methods from void to Task. Now they are returning processed task in case of assignment to a field on call.

*[tests/gdx-tests/src/com/badlogic/gdx/tests/TimerTest.java] Implemented changes in Timer class to TimerTest class.

Signed-off-by: Burak Kurkcu burakkurkcu@gmail.com

data.title: Fatal error in native Box2d Fixture code
data.body:
The program fails on line 73 of com/badlogic/gdx/physics/box2d/Body.java

```
public Fixture createFixture (FixtureDef def) {
    long fixtureAddr = jniCreateFixture(addr, def.shape.addr, def.friction, def.restitution, def.density, def.isSensor,
        def.filter.categoryBits, def.filter.maskBits, def.filter.groupIndex);
    Fixture fixture = this.world.freeFixtures.obtain();
    fixture.reset(this, fixtureAddr);
    this.world.fixtures.put(fixture.addr, fixture);
    this.fixtures.add(fixture);
    return fixture;
}
```

Here is the code to define the fixture in my code:
            PolygonShape p = new PolygonShape();
            Vector2[] vertList = {
                    new Vector2(0, 0),
                    new Vector2(2.6f, 0),
                    new Vector2(2.6f, .4f),
                    new Vector2(0, .4f)
            };
            p.set(vertList);
            FixtureDef fDef = new FixtureDef();
            fDef.shape = p;
            p.dispose();
            fDef.density = 5.0f;
            body.destroyFixture(body.getFixtureList().first());
            body.createFixture(fDef); // The exception is on this line

Below is the log output:

data.title: precision loss on spritebatch alpha chanel
fixes missing keycodes, cleans up & sorts existing ones - take 2

data.title: Add animated gif support to TexturePacker
data.body:
This allows animated gifs to be included for texture packing, automatically indexed for loading into an Animation. In my workflow I found it cumbersome to produce many png files for an animation, many of which were repeated to get the pauses necessary in certain animations. But apps like GIMP and Cosmigo Pro Motion can very easily produce animated gifs with variable length time delays, and the single file helps keep a version control directory from getting cluttered.

To allow for varied time delays per frame, a float version of a GCD is calculated, and frames of animation are repeated (aliased) to get timings that match the original gif. The GCD delay is output to console, and is the value that when used in the Animation constructor, will result in an Animation with timings that match the original gif. The float GCD algorithm requires some maximum allowable time error, so I added a setting for `maxAnimationDelayError`. This is the permissible variation in delay (in seconds) for each frame. Usually, the result will be significantly more accurate than the error. If the error setting is set to 0, then this step is skipped and no frames are repeated.

Maybe down the road we could consider expanding the pack format to provide animation delay information, but that would also require a new Animation type that supports variable delay. But I think in most cases, it would be more performant to use Animation as is with extra frames in its array of TextureRegions, so I think this GCD delay is a good solution. Gifs can be intentionally generated with a certain GCD in mind to minimize the number of frames that are generated.

I had to do a bit of a refactor for empty images to allow animations with empty frames. I figure that empty frames in an animation are not a mistake, and must be kept as timing placeholders, so for gifs only, the `ignoreBlankImages` setting is ignored. Also, the `useIndices` setting is ignored for gifs, since there can be no animation without indices.

data.title: IOS/RoboVM, ScreenUtils , empty texture when multisampling enabled
data.body:
It seems that readPixels, takes pixel data from wrong framebuffer resulting in empty pixels in screenshots when multisampling. As i googled , there is a glResolveMultisampleFramebufferAPPLE way (IOS + apple opengl extension ) and a glBlitFrameBuffer way (requires GL30) 

or 
For ios 5.x+, in IOSGraphics. there is a GLKView.getDrawableMultisample()
public native UIImage snapshot();

http://apidocs.robovm.com/1.0.0-SNAPSHOT/org/robovm/apple/glkit/GLKView.html#getDrawableMultisample()

GLKView is hidden but it can be accessible from ((IOSGraphics)Gdx.graphics).getView() ?

data.title: Input events change FPS
data.body: I used Gdx.graphics.setContinuousRendering(false); to have control on FPS but input events such as touch or mouse movement, create a burst calling render function which suddenly changes FPS and causes lag. I found a workaround for handling this situation on native android but I could not apply that because Libgdx does not provide me an interface for "dispatchTouchEvent" and I cannot tell Libgdx no to call ApplicationListener.render() method after each input event. here is the workaround: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/android-developers/Oe6k1_bm38o and here is another related topic: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/792185/why-are-touch-events-destroying-my-android-framerate

data.title: gdx-setup Link android/assets -> desktop/assets
data.body:
By default a -desktop project should use for its assets directory a link to the -android project's assets directory (if the -android project exists). When using gdx-setup to create a project that configuration rule is not automated. Instead libgdx docs say either to manually link them in the -desktop project properties (Resource > Linked Resources) or to configure the Run Configurations of the -desktop Java Application's Desktop Launcher's Arguments / Working Directory to be the -android/assets directory.

I'd like to revise gdx-setup to automate that configuration rule to link the directories. That generates in the -desktop/.project file some XML:

```
<linkedResources>
  <link>
    <name>assets</name>
    <type>2</type>
    <locationURI>PARENT-1-PROJECT_LOC/[base-project-name]-android/uniqueThing</locationURI>
  </link>
</linkedResources>
```

However, looking at the gdx-setup source code in github's libgdx / extensions / gdx-setup / src / com / badlogic / gdx / setup / I don't see where the app populates the project properties tree with properties for generating the XML. Where's the part of the setup algorithm that I'd revise to include the linkedResources tags?

data.title: Add texture repeating test
Impossible to catch "Error creating AudioTrack" on android
glGetError() logging would help catch bugs
data.body:
Some bugs like #2396 have come up where it's been difficult to pin down the cause, and it has ended up being improper issue of GL commands (e.g. outside of the render() loop).

It'd be helpful to log non-zero results from glGetError() to catch these conditions early. Maybe just log once, or each time the value changes? Maybe just one class shared among the backends, or maybe we can put it in the core code without touching the backends?

According to Apple, glGetError() may degrade performance so we would probably want a developer-mode switch.

data.title: GWT Export does not Prevent Default Key Presses
Fixes ScrollPane and non continuous rendering conflicts, see #2582 .
ScrollPane and non continuous rendering conflict.
data.body:
Hi,

my usecase is the following:

Disabling continuous rendering via `Gdx.graphics.setContinuousRendering(false);` and 
using Scene2D with the following option: `Stage.setActionsRequestRendering(true);`  we can still find an undesired behavior when using a ScrollPane with overScrollX/Y, fadeScrollBars and/or flingTime > 0.

This is because those ScrollPane interpolations are done directly in `ScrollPane#act(delta)` method (not via `Actions`), and this could be easily fixed setting `actionsChanged` to `true`.

If you don't mind I'll send a pr addressing this issue.

data.title: IOS NoSuchMethodError: org.robovm.apple.uikit.UITouch.getLocationInView
data.body:
Hi, since today I started getting this exception:

``` java
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.robovm.apple.uikit.UITouch.getLocationInView(Lorg/robovm/apple/uikit/UIView;)Lorg/robovm/apple/coregraphics/CGPoint;
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSInput.toTouchEvents(IOSInput.java)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSInput.touchDown(IOSInput.java)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSGraphics$1.touchesBegan(IOSGraphics.java)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSGraphics$1.$cb$touchesBegan$withEvent$(IOSGraphics.java)
at org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplication.main(Native Method)
at org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplication.main(UIApplication.java)
at com.kingmonkey.machaca.IOSLauncher.main(IOSLauncher.java)
```

It happen every time I touch the screen and I cannot find out what it is.
I'm using @BlueRiverInteractive's bindings, but in order to debug it I've disabled/removed all of them but it's the same. 
I'm testing on a real device.

Any thoughts?

PS: I'm on Libgdx version 1.4.2-SNAPSHOT, and Robovm version 1.0.0-alpha-04

data.title: NullPointerException due to combinedAttributes.get( TextureAttribute.Diffuse ) == null at DefaultShader.Setters.diffuseTexture.set()
data.body:
```
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g3d.shaders.DefaultShader$Setters$13.set(DefaultShader.java:220)
```

Happens quite randomly (sometimes 1 in 100 runs, sometimes a couple of times in a sequence _when no code was changed_), is not related to exact code and has no easy repro. The exact snippet of where this happens in on https://gist.github.com/vaxquis/8f6306a7bbe310e75cb5 - nb it's using the shadow batches, so I suppose this is somehow related to them.

I have pushed my libgdx based project to github, when i pull on another machine however, the libraries downloaded don't exist, and there is no easy way to keep the libs in the repo.

Should I just manually copy the libraries to my machine, or is there a better way?

data.title: Fixed Bug where AnimatedTiledMapTile sometimes couldn't find the correct frame
data.body: I've also changed the type of some variables from long to int because int is big enough. The variables describe the duration of one frame, the count of the frames and the absolute loop duration in milliseconds. Whit the use of int a loop duration of ca. 24 days is possible, which is enough.

data.title: iOS8 AVAudioSession SetActive Error
data.body:
We build our app using libgdx, it works perfectly well in ios7 or before, even ios8 stimulator.
But find an issue with AVAudioSession in iOS8.

I get the following error message:

AVAudioSession.mm:646: -[AVAudioSession setActive:withOptions:error:]: Deactivating an audio session that has running I/O. All I/O should be stopped or paused prior to deactivating the audio session.

Same problem occurs in ios8 to others, they fixed as followed:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24114323/ios8-avaudiosession-setactive-error

It is very urgent, waiting for the solution eagerly.

data.title: Possibly incorrect loading of TMX tilesets
data.body:
I've been working on using Tiled to create game levels and noticed an error. When creating a tileset with the 'Type' option of 'Collection of Images' in Tiled, the tileset is listed in the XML as this:

``` xml
 <tileset firstgid="1" name="tiles" tilewidth="200" tileheight="200">
  <tile id="0">
   <image width="64" height="64" source="droplet.png"/>
  </tile>
  <tile id="1">
   <image width="200" height="200" source="circle.png"/>
  </tile>
 </tileset>
```

When [TmxMapLoader.loadTilesets](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/15847c49e4c255ea2a9cdbb038f8782a811289de/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/maps/tiled/TmxMapLoader.java#L235) sees that the tileset was created from a collection of images (i.e. `source == null`) rather than the alternative 'Based on Tileset Image' (as the tileset itself doesn't have a single source) it tries to find the `image` child in the `tileset` root which doesn't exist here as it's inside the `tile` child. I think you would have to iterate over each `tile` in the `tileset` and pull the images from that. I would take a crack at it myself but I'm pretty new to libgdx and Tiled in general and modifying the source code and everything seems a little too daunting, so I figured I'd post about it here.

data.title: Position Widget in VerticalGroup
Make sure SelectBox does not use the old scrollToCenter API
data.body: With 830b1c1, `ScrollPane#scrollToCenter` has been removed, but `SelectBox` still called it in `#show` - this PR fixes it and calls `scrollTo` with `centerHorizontal` and `centerVertical` set to true.

data.title: handle "multiple" ContactListener scenario (Bullet wrapper)
data.body:
Obviously, since ContactListener is a Java-C++ bridge, connecting C++ static methods, it's impossible to have multiple functioning instances of them. Only one gets triggered, only one gets processed. Trying to enable (by overriding) different methods of the same kind triggers the expected behaviour - it raises an exception. Yet creating multiple ContactListener instances doesn't issue any kind of exception nor warning - it just silently overrides the settings of all the CL's other than the last one called.

What can be done about it? Some ideas off the top of my head:
1. in CL's constructor, detect if the static callback has been already set and either raise an exception or issue a warning, something along the lines of e.g. throw new GdxRuntimeException( "Only one ContactListener instance can be enabled at any given time. dispose() or disable() the previous one before creating another." ); or Gdx.app.error( "Only one ContactListener instance can be enabled at any given time. The prevously active instance has been disabled. dispose() or disable() the previous one before creating another to stop this error from being logged." );
2. require an explicit .enable() call after creating new CL,
3. clearly document existing behaviour in JavaDoc.

I'm aware that one may intentionally try to instantiate a new CL to "disable" the old one and "enable" a new one at the same time, but since a) this results in the old one being essentially inactive, b) it's also virtually impossible to track which one is active ATM, and c) the class is essentially undocumented, I suppose that at least some of the time (if not most) when this happens is just by pure accident. In current implementation/documentation state, it's completely unobvious that the CL's setting is static indeed.
